New Records: Sri Lanka secured their first ODI bilateral series win against India in 27 years.
Avishka Fernando's 96 was the highest individual score in the series.
India lost 27 wickets to spinners over the three-match series, their most in a three-match series.
Key Match Events: Dunith Wellalage took 5 wickets for 27 runs.
Riyan Parag took 3 wickets for 54 runs on his debut.
India was bowled out for 138 in 26.1 overs.
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma expressed concern over India's batting against spin.
Sri Lanka interim coach Sanath Jayasuriya and captain Charith Asalanka celebrated the series win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Sri Lanka's innings included two strong partnerships of 89 and 82 runs for the first and second wickets respectively.
Mohammed Siraj conceded 78 runs off 9 overs, his joint worst figures in ODIs.
Sri Lanka's middle order collapsed from 171 for 1 to 199 for 6.
